page.title: 01THE AREA OF ILMINGTON
page.content: Our area is on a slope of the{Cotswold Hills which give it shelter.The highest land is in the south west and it slopes down to the east.Little streams run down to the River{Stour } in the valley bottom.Standing on {Ilmington}Hill a network of roads and paths can be clearly picked out.They lead in all directions.Many long public footpaths go into the hills and villages which makes it an ideal walking area.The whole area is a patchwork of mixed{farms.}There is only one village in our block,{ {Ilmington}.{Ilmington}means "Elms on the hill", but not one of those beautiful trees now remains although most others thrive here.The {village} kept open by a series of greens throughout its length.
